title: Fixed Percent Discount
text: When the customer adds the Item Bundle to their transaction at the point of sale (POS), they will receive a percentage off the price of all the items included. For instance, if there is a hierarchy of items that are eligible for a 10% discount, you can create an Item Bundle containing all those items and apply a Fixed Percent Discount of 10%. As the cashier scans the qualifying items at the POS, 10% will be subtracted from the sales price. Once you're done, click the Save button to finish.

title: Deal Bundle
text: If you purchase all the products included in the 'Deal Bundle', this is the price you will pay. This promotion is ideal for bundling together related items, such as batteries for a remote control car or wrapping paper with a gift. To take advantage of this promotion, you need to create Item Bundles that include the item(s) eligible for the promotion. At least one quantity of each item should be added to the transaction to activate the promotion. You can create multiple Item Bundles, but remember that you must purchase at least one of each item to qualify for the promotion. Once you select the 'Deal Bundle', make sure to complete the 'bundle cost' fields to indicate the price the customer will pay for the group of goods in each currency. For each item listed, adjust the Quantity field according to the promotion's requirements. For example, if the customer needs to buy 3 of a particular item, modify the Quantity field accordingly. To edit the quantity, use the provided and enter the required amount, then press enter. When you're done, click the Save button to finish.

title: Least Expensive
text: The "Least Expensive" promotion allows you to buy a certain quantity of items and receive a percentage discount on the lowest-priced item. For example, the promotion could be "Buy 3 and get the least expensive item for half price." To set up this promotion, follow these steps: Create an Item Bundle that includes the item(s) eligible for this promotion. In the first field, enter the number of items from the Item Bundle that the customer must purchase to qualify for the promotion (e.g., 3). In the second field, enter the percentage discount that the customer will receive on the lowest-priced item (e.g., 50%). In the third field, enter the number of items to which the promotion applies (e.g., 1, indicating that the discount applies to the least expensive item). Once you've filled in the necessary information, click the Save button to finalize the setup. Remember to adjust the values based on your specific promotion details.

title: Mandatory Choice
text: This promotion triggers when all the mandatory items are added to a single transaction, then a percentage discount is applied to all mandatory and optional qualifying items. For example, the promotion is to apply a 5% to a set of umbrellas when the customer purchases a box of golf balls. The golf balls are made the mandatory item by selecting the item check box and clicking Mandatory. All items in the promotion are detailed in an Item Bundle. An item can only appear as either Mandatory or Optional, but not both. You can add one or more items to the Mandatory list, noting that on the transaction each mandatory item must be added before the promotion is triggered. You can also specify the number of mandatory items that must be purchased e.g. two boxes of golf balls are required so the Quantity is set to 2. When the golf balls and an umbrella are added to the transaction the customer receives a 5% discount on both items. If the customer chooses to purchase only the umbrella they will not receive the 5% promotion. Click the Save button to complete.

title: Multi Buy with Percentage
text: This promotion allows you to set a per cent discount per unit when the unit(s) are bought in multiples. This is similar to Multi Buy With Price Per Item but based on percentage discount. For example, if the customer purchases 2 items listed in the Item Bundle a discount of 5% is applied to the transaction. If the customer wishes to buy 3 items the price per unit has a 7% discount applied. Under the Steps section click the + button. Enter the Quantity as the number of units needed to trigger the discount, then enter the Discount Percent. Click the Save button to complete.

title: Discount Item Percentage
text: This promotion allows you to discount individual items by a percentage. This is useful for items that do not fit into a bundle or where you wish to manage them individually. For example, I have a range of end-of-line items in different hierarchies and from different vendors. I wish to reduce these by a range of 10% to 20%. Note: the Item Bundles option is not available on this screen. Items are added individually. Set the Promotion Engine type to Discount Item Percentage. In the Discount Items By Percentage list click the + button. Enter the Item No for the item you wish to discount. If the Item No is not valid you should check the number, only Item No's as listed on the Matrix tab for an item are valid. Under the Discount Percent field enter the percent you wish this item to be discounted by. Click the Save button to complete.

title: Discount Item Amount
text: This promotion allows you to discount individual items to a set price. This is useful for items that do not fit into a bundle or where you wish to manage them individually. For example, I have a range of end-of-line items in different hierarchies and from different vendors. I wish to reduce the price of these to assist with sales. NOTE: The Item Bundles option is not available on this screen. Items are added individually. Set the Promotion Engine type to Discount Item Amount. In the Select, The Item And Set A Price For It list click the + button. Enter the Barcode for the item you wish to discount. If the Barcode is not valid you should check the number, only Barcodes listed on the Matrix tab for an item are valid. Under the Price field enter in the price you wish this item to be sold for at the PoS. Click the Save button when done. Use the icons to make changes where necessary.

title: Multi Buy with Price Per Item
text: This promotion allows you to set a quantity price per unit when the unit(s) are bought in multiples, similar to price breaks. For example, your item's price is 15 for a single unit. If the customer purchases two of these items the price reduces to 13 per unit and if the customer wishes to buy three items the price per unit reduces to 11. The items applied to this promotion are specified in the Item Bundle list. Under the Steps section click the + button. Enter the Quantity as the number of units needed to trigger the new price, then enter the price per unit. If you use multiple currencies then you should enter a price for each currency. Click the Save button when done. Use the icons to make changes where necessary.
